definitions.definition: To render unable ; to take away an ability of, as by crippling.
To impair the physical or mental abilities of; to cause a serious, permanent injury .
examples: Falling off the horse disabled him.

definitions.definition: To deactivate, to make inoperational (especially of a function of an electronic or mechanical device).
examples: The pilot had to disable the autopilot of his airplane.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To render unable ; to take away an ability of, as by crippling.
secondary_definitions: ( chiefly of a person ) To impair the physical or mental abilities of; to cause a serious, permanent injury .
( chiefly electronics , computing ) To deactivate, to make inoperational (especially of a function of an electronic or mechanical device).
